summary: "I think we're importing their negativity. I don't think it's necessarily going to last," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Thursday morning.
headline: Cramer says investors will regret selling U.S. stocks on coronavirus spikes in Europe

summary: America's malls' future prospects — fulfillment centers, apartment complexes, schools or medical offices — could mean massive write-offs in property values, according to a new Barclays report.
headline: Turning a dead mall into a warehouse will slash its value as much as 90%, Barclays predicts
This Amazon program is helping people get training, certification and jobs in cloud computing
summary: The AWS re/Start program partners with local workforce development groups to provide free cloud training, certification and job placement for graduates to start a new career in technology.

headline: Alphabet is trialing solar-paneled, robotic buggies to inspect farm crops
summary: The vehicles can collect a large amount of data for analysis.
France and the Netherlands have proposed stricter EU rules to oversee large technology firms, such as Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.
headline: France and the Netherlands call for tough EU powers to curb Big Tech

summary: DraftKings will integrate its content across Turner Sports platforms, but the agreement excludes the NBA.
headline: DraftKings strikes another media partnership, this time with AT&T's Turner Sports

summary: Two traders sift through a group of stocks "on sale" to find bargain buys in the market.
headline: These stocks trading at discounts to their valuations may be worth buying, traders say
Full lockdowns should be a 'very, very last resort' and can be avoided, WHO's Europe chief says
summary: As Europe introduces more and more restrictive measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus, full-scale lockdowns should be a "very, very last resort."

headline: Morgan Stanley is set to report third-quarter earnings – here’s what the Street expects
summary: CEO James Gorman has doubled down on his push to diversify away from Morgan Stanley’s traditional strengths of trading and investment banking.
Twitter has confirmed it is going to start removing posts that deny the Holocaust from its platform just days after Facebook implemented the same policy.
headline: Twitter follows Facebook on removing posts that deny the Holocaust
France and Netherlands Back EU Plans to Rein in Tech Platforms - Bloomberg
summary: France and Netherlands Back EU Plans to Rein in Tech Platforms  Bloomberg

headline: U.S. reportedly explores sanctions on China's Ant Group. Analysts say they'll be 'largely symbolic'
summary: Washington is trying to put Ant Group on the U.S. Entity List, Reuters reported. But with the company's on the domestic market and very little business outside, a blacklisting is likely to have little impact.

headline: China's pork prices rise at the slowest pace in more than a year
summary: The consumer price index rose 1.7% in September from a year ago, China's National Bureau of Statistics said Thursday.

headline: Fastly is a buy if the stock continues to tank on revenue guidance cut, Cramer says
summary: "The fact is this is a wild trader that was due for big sell-off anyway," CNBC's Jim Cramer said. " "Now the stock has been significantly de-risked ... and I actually like it more."
The Economic Cycle Research Institute’s Lakshman Achuthan highlights his latest inflation call in a special chart.
headline: Inflation is making a 'pervasive and persistent' comeback, economic forecaster Lakshman Achuthan warns
Cramer reveals what stocks he finds would benefit from a Biden presidency
summary: "When it comes to earnings, to prospects, to growth, I was absolutely stunned that two-thirds of the stocks in my charitable trust would likely make more money under Biden than under Trump," the "Mad Money" host said.
The NFL voted to move its Super Bowl LVIII event in 2024 to Las Vegas after the agreement with New Orleans conflicted with Mardi Gras due to the league's new regular-season schedule.
headline: After Mardi Gras scheduling conflict, NFL bumps New Orleans Super Bowl from 2024 to 2025

summary: Amazon previously said it wouldn't ding warehouse workers if they took too many breaks as a coronavirus safety measure.
headline: Amazon has resumed policies that penalize workers for taking too many breaks, just in time for Prime Day

summary: "The learning goes backward. That's a particular problem in the developing world," according to David Malpass, president of the World Bank.
headline: 1 billion kids in developing nations may be out of school due to pandemic, says World Bank head
Stock futures are flat as Wall Street tries to recover from 2-day slide
summary: U.S. stock futures were flat on Wednesday night as traders continued to weigh the prospects for a coronavirus aid deal being reached.
